questions.question: They printed these books. These books ………………….. by them.
questions.description: In the simple past, we make the passive form by putting the past participle form of the verb after was/were.

questions.question: Clean the room. Let the room …………………….
questions.description: Passive forms of imperatives are made with be + past participle.

questions.question: The teacher reprimanded the boy. The boy …………………….. by the teacher.
questions.description: In the simple past, we make the passive form by putting the past participle form of the verb after was/were.

questions.question: They will announce the results in the afternoon. Results ……………………….. in the afternoon.
questions.description: In the simple future, the passive form is made by putting will + be before the past participle form of the verb.

questions.question: Everybody hates him. He …………………….. by everybody.
questions.description: In the simple present tense, we make the passive form with is/am/are + past participle form of the verb.

questions.question: The monkey is eating a banana. A banana …………………….. by the monkey.
questions.description: In the present continuous, we make the passive form by putting is/am/are + being before the past participle form of the verb.

questions.question: The government will build a bridge. A bridge …………………….. by the government.
questions.description: In the simple future, the passive form is made by putting will + be before the past participle form of the verb.

questions.question: She gave me a book. I …………………… a book by her.
questions.description: In the simple past, we make the passive form by putting the past participle form of the verb after was/were.

questions.question: She cheated him. He ……………………. by her.
questions.description: In the simple past, we make the passive form by putting the past participle form of the verb after was/were.

questions.question: I have sent the parcel. The parcel ………………………….. by me.
questions.description: In the present perfect tense, the passive form is made by putting has/have + been before the past participle form of the verb.

questions.question: He has composed a song. A song ………………………. by him.
questions.description: In the present perfect tense, the passive form is made by putting has/have + been before the past participle form of the verb.

questions.question: The teacher asked him to get out. He ………………………. by the teacher to get out.
questions.description: In the simple past, we make the passive form by putting the past participle form of the verb after was/were.
